abstract: Oracle may be about to get a taste of its own medicine, after lobbying the European Union to force one of its biggest competitors, Microsoft, to loosen its iron-like grip on software code and other intellectual property.
snippet: Oracle may be about to get a taste of its own medicine, after lobbying the European Union to force one of its biggest competitors, Microsoft, to loosen its iron-like grip on software code and other intellectual property.
lead_paragraph: Oracle has spent much of the past decade lobbying to get European Union regulators to force one of its biggest competitors, Microsoft, to loosen its iron-like grip on software code and other intellectual property.

headline.main: Europe’s Challenge to Oracle Deal Has Deep Roots
